Text.Value: I was harsh on myself before - on my leadership of the grove, the decisions I made... perhaps too harsh, considering this place.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: Sometimes it is difficult to see exactly what we are fighting to save here. Sometimes it feels like Kagha was right - nature can only survive away from all this...

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: Indeed. But I cannot shake it from my mind, all the same...

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: I don't think you truly feel that way. You have always believed in balance.
Thank you - your wisdom shines through even in dark moments. I shall not give in to despair. Not while there is still the chance of a future worth fighting for.
The Shadow Druids peddle easy answers and sow division. Don't fall for their rhetoric.
You saw how that young boy was being treated on the streets, didn't you? That man considered him a stain.

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry at the memory of something he witnessed

Text.Value: Survive, perhaps. I am less sure about thriving. To be part of the world, you must be connected to it. True balance cannot be achieved unless all is accounted for.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: You speak nothing but the truth. The Shadow Druids' words are meant to inflame those already given to anger and helplessness - I do not want to join their ranks.
I do... but at times like this, it can feel like an impossible dream.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: I... you are right. I cannot repeat her mistakes.
Is this truly what progress looks like?

EditorData.NodeContext: Critical of what he's seeing in the city

Text.Value: Sometimes it is difficult to see exactly what we are fighting to save here. Sometimes the Shadow Druids' desire to separate nature from all this seems pragmatic, not fanatical...

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: Civilisation is but an extension of nature. They can thrive together, if given the chance. Same as Thaniel and Oliver.
A fine point. I wish I had thought of it myself.
Perhaps that's true. Your way of life could thrive in isolation.
I had hoped there might be a greater sense of balance within the city - that its walls might enable sheltering within it to foster community, peace... yet it is not so.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: Kagha sought easy answers and succumbed to zealotry. You're better than that.
You saw how they wished to burn the clothes of a child? As if being crammed in this very city is not the cause of lice and disease?

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry at the memory of something he witnessed

Text.Value: Unnatural steel beings patrol the streets, the printed word sows discontent, and those in need are treated with disdain.

EditorData.NodeContext: Somewhat troubled. Doesn't like what he's been seeing of civilisation and how people are treated

Text.Value: It's a moot point unless we manage to stop the Absolute.

Synopsis: Halsin's default in-party dialogue once you have him available as a companion. You recruit/dismiss him, and discuss an assortment of topics with him.
